messageBody:
Dave Astels wrote:

>On Wed, 2002-08-21 at 10:47, Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-MBC) wrote:
> So, I'd say if you've got that many test methods floating about, you
> may want to think about breaking up your classes somewhat.
However, there's
> nothing that says you can't create multiple test classes to test a
single
> class, then come up with some way to divvy up your tests (all null
tests go
> in one class, etc.).
>
>Yes, TestCases aren't meant to correspond to classes begin
>tested/driven. They are a fixture mechanism. The tests in a single
>
>
In response to this, might it not be better to propose a non-destructive
change to JUnit ? Maybe TestCase should really be called TestFixture,
then people would not be so afraid to use a new TestFixture when needed,
compared to a new TestCase...

Have a nice day !
